item.title: Demand for cash in turbulent times
item.description: Antti Heinonen analyses trends in cash use as Covid fades, but new shocks take its place

item.title: Kenyan governor denies shortage of small-denomination notes
item.description: Interior minister had claimed that politicians were draining supply to pay election bribes

item.title: Zimbabwe freezes all bank lending
item.description: President announces controls on money creation to stem decline of currency

item.title: Union objects to Colombian central bank’s branch closures
item.description: Bank of the Republic is converting some regional offices to cultural centres, closing treasuries

item.title: Australia’s central bank to review banknote distribution model
item.description: Decline in transactional cash usage has led to excess capacity

item.title: Canadians ditched cash during pandemic, research shows
item.description: Central bank data shows cash withdrawals fell in comparison to debit card transactions

item.title: UK public has ‘reasonable’ access to cash, regulators say
item.description: But pandemic made it difficult for people to access and pay with cash, new research finds

item.title: RBNZ to consider CBDC as cash use declines
item.description: Assistant governor says trust in financial system may be weakened by fall in cash use

item.title: BoE to close cash distribution centre in 2023
item.description: Cash operations will continue at Debden site while BoE reviews geographical footprint

item.title: Riksbank to open two contingency cash offices
item.description: Offices will be opened this year and next to guard against disruptions to cash supply

item.title: RBNZ governor: lawmakers must help preserve cash access
item.description: New Zealand governor says industry and politicians must respond to the rise of “less cash” society

item.title: Belgium to launch new ‘smart’ ATM network
item.description: Network will look to solve geographical disparity and maintain cash services

item.title: Are we sleepwalking into a cashless society?
item.description: Cash could be crowded out of the payment landscape if current trends continue, but should central banks be responsible for ensuring its survival?

item.title: De La Rue faces uncertain future as profits collapse
item.description: Profits plummet 87% as firm scrambles to cut costs

item.title: Cash increasingly used as store of value – BIS report
item.description: Cash “still king”, BIS authors say, but electronic payments are taking a bigger share of transactions

item.title: Rwanda central bank spearheading cashless movement
item.description: Central bank reports e-payments have increased to 34.6% of GDP, but says there is still work to be done

item.title: Demand for cash remains solid in many parts of the world
item.description: Sayuri Shirai re-examines the decline of cash use worldwide

item.title: The future of cash: an update
item.description: Antti Heinonen looks at the latest trends in cash use, including a surprising turnaround for the Swedish krona

item.title: RBNZ may gain new powers to protect access to cash
item.description: Consultation proposes more active role for central bank; regulations could mandate access to cash

item.title: Cash no longer US’s most popular means of payment
item.description: Debit cards were the most frequently used means of payment in 2018, Fed report finds

item.title: Israel’s Steiner: central banks must adapt to changing banknote demand
item.description: Ilan Steiner highlights importance of banknote data in forecasting future demand

item.title: BoE evaluating ‘utility’ cash distribution model
item.description: Model has helped streamline operations in countries where cash usage is on the decline, including Finland and Sweden

item.title: Access to cash a priority for UK’s PSR this year – report
item.description: Regulator criticised for response to earlier report which said 17% of population would struggle without cash

item.title: Print-your-own banknotes could be the future – DNB official
item.description: Single-use banknotes with QR codes could be the future of cash, DNB cash head says

item.title: Central banks disagree over cash regulation
item.description: The BoE has issued legislation demanding banks supply certain denominations, but other regulators remain on the fence about how they should manage the future of cash

item.title: Lack of accurate data poses challenges for cash forecasting
item.description: Anonymity of cash makes it hard to track as a payment instrument, panel agrees

item.title: UK cash system needs revamp, says Payment Systems Regulator chair
item.description: Charles Randell tells lawmakers the regulator will look at entire cash provision infrastructure in 2019

item.title: Interview: Jussi Kangas on the future of cash
item.description: Bank of Finland adviser says it’s challenging to keep the cash cycle efficient as usage falls

item.title: Rwanda to issue new banknotes
item.description: New 500 and 1,000 franc notes will have new security features and design elements

item.title: Liberia steps up monitoring of NPLs
item.description: New credit reference system to help financial institutions keep track of credit history and debt obligations; investigation ongoing into ‘missing’ banknotes

item.title: Zimbabwe’s government hunts for dollar alternative
item.description: Continuing with dollarised economy could mean return to hyperinflation, economist says

item.title: Book notes: Democratizing Money?, by Beat Weber
item.description: This is a timely book about ‘how money really works’

item.title: UK’s Link implements new fees in bid to halt ATM closures
item.description: Subsidy paid by banks to cash machine operators rises to up to £2.75

item.title: Fed launches banknote app for children
item.description: App provides details of security features, mimicking raised intaglio print through vibrations

item.title: Innovation prompts firms to hold more cash – IMF paper
item.description: Firms must hold enough liquidity to insure against risky research and development

item.title: Private mints to help with £1 overseas distribution
item.description: Royal Mint will provide blanks for overseas territories but design and distribution is responsibility of individual regions

item.title: Central Bank of Kenya intervenes amid coin confusion
item.description: No limits on coin distribution, central bank says, following reports initial caps remain in place

item.title: Nepalese central bank seeks Indian help over large denomination notes
item.description: Nepal Rastra Bank asks RBI to permit new Indian notes to be used as legal tender

item.title: Book notes: EuroTragedy, by Ashoka Mody
item.description: The former International Monetary Fund insider elegantly tells the story of the creation of the currency that has defied economics, warning that it could get “worse, much worse”

item.title: Iran to cut four zeros from currency
item.description: Currency continues to depreciate, inflation climbs and growth slows

item.title: New Zambian banknotes cause trouble for ATMs
item.description: Central bank advises public to deposit new notes at banks due to a delay in ATM calibration

item.title: RBA authors try to estimate banknotes’ whereabouts
item.description: Information is sparse on the period between a banknote’s issuance and its destruction

item.title: Crypto assets: Should regulation be the top priority?
The euro: a troubled third decade?
item.description: Italy’s pact-busting budget highlights ongoing eurozone frailties

item.title: Bank of Mexico opens second banknote printing plant
item.description: Existing facility has reached capacity and cannot keep up with banknote demand, says governor

item.title: West African single currency plans move towards lift-off
item.description: Ecowas community launches competition for design of new currency aimed at strengthening trade and growth within the region

item.title: BoE launches comms push as it seeks face for £50 note
item.description: Central bank seeks boost to public engagement from nominations and ‘Future Forum’

item.title: Dollar strength drives yuan to lowest level in a decade
item.description: Higher US rates are narrowing interest rate differential as Chinese growth weakens

item.title: Riksbank says all banks should be ‘obliged’ to continue cash services
item.description: Central bank goes “a step further” in ensuring government legislation keeps cash alive in Sweden

item.title: Australia to launch new $50 note
item.description: Successful transition to new $5 and $10 notes opened door for most circulated note
